key_points: Tiger Woods referred to Ben Hogan's comeback as one of the greatest in sports, highlighting Hogan's major wins after a bus accident.
Woods won the 2019 Masters, marking a significant comeback after years of injuries, comparing his journey to Hogan's.
Ben Hogan is known for his remarkable comeback in golf after a near-fatal car accident in 1949, winning seven majors subsequently.
Hogan and Woods are linked in golf history for their dominance in the sport and significant comebacks from physical adversities.
Speculation about another major comeback for Woods arose after his car accident in California, drawing parallels to Hogan's recovery.
Hogan suffered multiple injuries from a head-on collision but made a miraculous recovery to return to professional golf.
Hogan's comeback was marked by physical challenges and a lack of modern medical support, relying on personal resilience.
Unlike Hogan, Woods has significant financial security and access to advanced medical and rehabilitation resources.
Hogan's legacy includes winning multiple major championships post-recovery and establishing a successful golf club company.
The Golf Writers Association of America's Ben Hogan Award, for active golfers overcoming physical hardships, was awarded to Woods in 2019.
